remarks: If a set ` A ` is equinumerous to the successor of a natural number ` M ` , then ` A ` with an element removed is equinumerous to ` M ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
dif1en.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
dif1enOLD $p |- ( ( M e. _om /\ A ~~ suc M /\ X e. A ) -> ( A \ { X } ) ~~ M ) $.
